intro: Ardisia repandula, commonly known as the broadleaf ardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as blueberries and heathers. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are typically oval or elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Ardisia repandula thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
